column4: Anyone knows how to delete every file found with locate ndiswrapper with the rm command?
this should work: sudo find / -name "*ndiswrapper*" -delete     I really really really dont reccomend doing it though, you idealy should be purging out those config files using apt.
then dont do that, use apt.
sudo apt-get remove --purge ndiswrapper ; sudo apt-get install ndiswrapper
